Back: How did you try to install it?
Isn't there an RPM for it?
Then just convert that to a .deb pkg with 'alien' and install it. :)
Doesn't matter, try it out. :) It can't hurt. You can always uninstall it again.

Just install 'alien' (it should be in the packages list) and then get the RPM and do 'alien skype-xxxxx.rpm' and then 'dpkg -i skype_xxxxx.deb' (where the x's are replaced by the rest of the file name.
Go after a RedHat if possible.
